page.title: 07LITTLEMOSS
page.content: The village of Littlemoss is essentially a dormitory settlement for Droylsden and Manchester, but still has a farming community at its heart. One of the farms incorporates the oldest building of the village. This is{Cinderland Hall,}now a barn, but thought to date back to the 17th century. The early industry of the area has disappeared now and traces remain only as road names. The flax industry flourished here. It was grown on the Moss (Marshland) and green allowed to dry in stoops. Today these locations are remembered in the names{Greenside {Lane and Sunnyside Road. }Coal mining took place near the Medlock Valley in particular at{Daisy Nook}and near{Bell {Clough}(from the bell pits).
